message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s sexual activity and inconsistent use of condoms suggest the need to rule out pregnancy before starting any medication. Serum beta-hCG levels are used to diagnose pregnancy. Oral contraceptives can be effective in treating acne, but they should not be started until pregnancy is ruled out. Switching cephalexin to doxycycline may be an option, but again, pregnancy should be ruled out first. Measuring creatinine kinase levels is not relevant to the patient’s presentation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is sexually active and inconsistent in using condoms, suggesting the possibility of pregnancy. Therefore, measuring serum beta-hCG levels is the most appropriate next step to rule out pregnancy before initiating treatment. Administering oral contraceptives is a treatment option, but should not be given without ruling out pregnancy first. Switching antibiotics is not necessary without confirming the diagnosis or ruling out other conditions. Measuring creatinine kinase levels is not relevant to the diagnosis or treatment of acne.

Certain acne medications can be harmful to a developing fetus, so measuring serum beta-hCG levels is necessary to rule out pregnancy before initiating treatment. Options A and B can be considered as part of acne treatment, but first, pregnancy must be ruled out. Option D is not relevant to the patient’s presentation.
